de.polygonal.ds.LinkedStack<T>

type
class
implements
Stack<T>

A stack based on a linked list.

A stack is a linear list for which all insertions and deletions (and usually all accesses) are made at one end of the list.

This is called a FIFO structure (First In, First Out).

See http://lab.polygonal.de/2007/05/23/data-structures-example-the-queue-class/

Constructor

new(?reservedSize : Int, ?maxSize : Int)

parameters
reservedSize if > 0, this stack maintains an object pool of node objects.
Prevents frequent node allocation and thus increases performance at the cost of using more memory.
maxSize the maximum allowed size of the stack.
The default value of -1 indicates that there is no upper limit.
throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError reserved size is greater than allowed size (debug only).

Instance Variables

key : Int

A unique identifier for this object.
A hash table transforms this key into an index of an array element by using a hash function.
This value should never be changed by the user.

maxSize : Int

The maximum allowed size of this stack.
Once the maximum size is reached, adding an element will fail with an error (debug only).
A value of -1 indicates that the size is unbound.
Always equals -1 in release mode.

Instance Methods

assign(C : Class<T>, ?args : Array<Dynamic>, ?n : Int) : Void

parameters
C the class to instantiate for each element.
args passes additional constructor arguments to the class C.
n the number of elements to replace. If 0, n is set to size().
throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError n out of range (debug only).
Replaces up to n existing elements with objects of type C.

clear(?purge : Bool) : Void

parameters
purge if true, elements are nullified upon removal.
Removes all elements.

clone(assign : Bool, ?copier : T -> T) : Collection<T>

parameters
assign if true, the copier parameter is ignored and primitive elements are copied by value whereas objects are copied by reference.
If false, the clone() method is called on each element. In this case all elements have to implement Cloneable.
copier a custom function for copying elements. Replaces element.clone() if assign is false.
throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError element is not of type Cloneable (debug only).
Duplicates this stack. Supports shallow (structure only) and deep copies (structure & elements).

contains(x : T) : Bool

Returns true if this stack contains the element x.

inline cpy(i : Int, j : Int) : Void

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError stack is empty. (debug only).
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError index out of range (debug only).
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError i equals j (debug only).
Overwrites the element at index i with the element from index j.
An index of 0 indicates the bottommost element.
An index of size() - 1 indicates the topmost element.

inline dup() : Void

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError stack is empty (debug only).
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError size() equals maxSize (debug only).
Pops the top element of the stack, and pushes it back twice, so that an additional copy of the former top item is now on top, with the original below it.

inline exchange() : Void

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError size() < 2 (debug only).
Swaps the two topmost items on the stack.

fill(x : T, ?n : Int) : Void

parameters
n the number of elements to replace. If 0, n is set to size().
throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError n out of range (debug only).
Replaces up to n existing elements with the instance of x.

free() : Void

Destroys this object by explicitly nullifying all nodes, pointers and elements.
Improves GC efficiency/performance (optional).

inline get(i : Int) : T

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError stack is empty or index out of range (debug only).
Returns the element stored at index i.
An index of 0 indicates the bottommost element.
An index of size() - 1 indicates the topmost element.

inline isEmpty() : Bool

Returns true if this stack is empty.

iterator() : Itr<T>

see
http://haxe.org/ref/iterators
Returns a new LinkedStackIterator object to iterate over all elements contained in this stack.
Preserves the natural order of the stack (First-In-Last-Out).

inline pop() : T

returns
the top element.
throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError stack is empty (debug only).
Pops data off the stack.

inline push(x : T) : Void

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError size() equals maxSize (debug only).
Pushes the element x onto the stack.

remove(x : T) : Bool

returns
true if at least one occurrence of x was removed.
Removes and nullifies all occurrences of the element x.

inline rotLeft(n : Int) : Void

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError size() >= n (debug only).
Moves the n topmost elements on the stack in a rotating fashion.
Example: 
	  top
	  |3|              |2|
	  |2|  rotate left |1|
	  |1|      -->     |0|
	  |0|              |3|

inline rotRight(n : Int) : Void

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError size() >= n (debug only).
Moves the n topmost elements on the stack in a rotating fashion.
Example: 
	  top
	  |3|               |0|
	  |2|  rotate right |3|
	  |1|      -->      |2|
	  |0|               |1|

inline set(i : Int, x : T) : Void

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError stack is empty or index out of range (debug only).
Replaces the element at index i with the element x.
An index of 0 indicates the bottommost element.
An index of size() - 1 indicates the topmost element.

shuffle(?rval : DA<Float>) : Void

parameters
rval a list of random double values in the range between 0 (inclusive) to 1 (exclusive) defining the new positions of the elements. If omitted, random values are generated on-the-fly by calling Math.random().
throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError insufficient random values (debug only).
Shuffles the elements of this collection by using the Fisher-Yates algorithm.

inline size() : Int

The total number of elements.

inline swp(i : Int, j : Int) : Void

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError stack is empty. (debug only).
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError index out of range (debug only).
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError i equals j (debug only).
Swaps the element stored at i with the element stored at index j.
An index of 0 indicates the bottommost element.
An index of size() - 1 indicates the topmost element.

toArray() : Array<T>

Returns an array containing all elements in this stack.
Preserves the natural order of this stack (First-In-Last-Out).

toDA() : DA<T>

Returns a dense array containing all elements in this stack.
Preserves the natural order of this stack (First-In-Last-Out).

toString() : String

Returns a string representing the current object.
Prints out all elements if compiled with the -debug directive.
Example:

	  var ls = new de.polygonal.ds.LinkedStack<Int>();
	  ls.push(0);
	  ls.push(1);
	  ls.push(2);
	  trace(ls);
	  {LinkedStack size: 3}
	  |< top
	      0 -> 2
	      1 -> 1
	      2 -> 0
	  >|

inline top() : T

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError stack is empty (debug only).
Returns the top element of this stack.
This is the "newest" element.
